Tony Abbott

Liberal Party Representative for Warringah

Leader of the Opposition

Representative for Warringah since March 1994

Never rebels. explain rebellions

Attended 50% of votes (1 of 2). explain attendance

Note: our voting records currently only go back to the beginning of 2006 for the House of Representatives and the Senate (more details).

Votes in parliament for which this Representative's vote differed from the majority vote of their party (Rebel).

Date Subject Tony Abbott Liberal Party Vote Role

Possible Friends (more...)

Shows which Representatives voted most similarly to this one in the Parliament. This is measured from 0% agreement (never voted the same) to 100% (always voted the same). Only votes that both Representatives attended are counted. This may reveal relationships between Representatives that were previously unsuspected. Or it may be nonsense.

Agreement Name Electorate Party
85.714% Kevin Rudd Griffith Australian Labor Party

About the Project

The Public Whip is brought to you by the not-for-profit OpenAustralia Foundation. It is based on the UK site of the same name.

If you'd like to talk to us about the project, please email us.

Other projects by us that you might find interesting:
OpenAustralia, Election Leaflets, Right To Know and Planning Alerts.
The Public Whip is a not-for-profit, open source, project. Get the source code.
